contentrichtext.text: [[File:Hasselberg bild.gif|thumb|Per Hasselberg (1850-1894)]] [[Image:Svöklockan 2010.jpg|thumb|left|upright|''Snöklockan'' at [[Mariatorget]], [[Stockholm]].]] '''Per Hasselberg''' (January 1, 1850 – July 25, 1894) was a [[Sweden|Swedish]] [[sculpture|sculptor]]. He was also known as Petter Hasselberg or Petter Åkesson. Little known outside Sweden, his delicate marble [[Nudity|nudes]] have received critical acclaim. Hasselberg grew up in [[Blekinge]], but moved to [[Paris]] as a young man, where he studied under [[François Jouffroy]]. His first notable work was a sculpture titled ''Snöklockan''.
